results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.creator_credit: Kazuhiko Watanabe, H.C. Andersen, Masaji Hara, Matsue Jimbo, Shigeki Ishikawa and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: Using toy like models of animals and birds, this film tells Hans Christian Anderson’s story of the hardships undergone by an ugly duckling until he finds himself a beautiful swan.

results.title: The Ugly duckling
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. The well-known Hans Christian Anderson fairy tale of the ugly baby duck that turned out to be a beautiful swan when it grew up is retold with live animals. Filmed in Europe, real ducks, chickens, geese and swans are pictured against authentic background settings.

results.title: The Typewriter, the rifle and the movie camera
results.creator_credit: Adam Simon, Colin MacCabe, Paula Jalfon, BFI, Channel Four, Havoc Inc, Independent Film Channel and Museum of Modern Art (New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: A fascinating documentary about Sam Fuller, of one of Hollywood’s most illustrious writers and directors. Tim Robbins and director Adam Simon travelled to Paris, where Fuller resided for thirteen years until the mid nineties, to interview him. Through conversations with Fuller the film explores his biographical and stylistic roots and examines the three primary phases of his professional life as a newspaperman, a soldier and as a filmmaker. Observations from Jim Jarmusch, Martin Scorsese and Quentin Tarantino and extracts from Fuller’s films reveal an extraordinary portrait of one of Hollywood’s true mavericks.

results.title: The Two faces of Japan
results.brief_description: A documentary of social, political and economic life in Japan today. Interviews the Japanese Prime Minister, Mr Ikeda and the late Leader of the Opposition, who was tragically assassinated a few days later. Gives insight into the conflicting influences of East and West in studies of the daily lives of four typical Japanese - a fashion model, a university student, a skilled worker in the Kobe Kawasaka Dockyard, and an Osaka suburban housewife.

results.title: The Twelve days of Christmas
results.brief_description: Stills from the picture book illustrated by Robert Broomfield and accompanied by the music and song. Jennifer Brown sings the lyrics as the geese, swans, doves, drummers, pipers, dancing ladies and the partridge all appear on screen.

results.title: The Turn of the tide
results.creator_credit: Ian G Wallis and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Discusses the ecology of the shore of Westernport Bay, Victoria, and the effects on it of waterfront settlement and development and consequent water pollution. Shows research on the problem in progress.

results.creator_credit: Joseph Krumgold and National Educational Television

results.title: The True story of the Civil War
results.creator_credit: Louis Clyde Stoumen and Camera Eye Pictures
results.brief_description: A record of the American Civil War period made up mostly with Mathew Brady’s original wet plate photographs made on the field of battle and contemporary newspaper illustrations (Harper’s Weekly). Relates the story of the war, describing its causes, its battles, its leaders and its effects on the nation. Narrated by Raymond Massey. (Award: Best Documentary, Short Subjects, 1957 Academy Awards)

results.title: The True story of Lili Marlene
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the British counter-propaganda campaign against the popular German forces program from the Belgrade Radio. The theme song “Lili Marlene” introduced the German “Message from Home” session. The film shows how the Germans came to use the song, how the British captured it and how the BBC turned the song to our advantage during the African Desert campaign. The British Eighth Army adopted “Lili Marlene” as their own special marching song. Appearance by Marius Goring.

results.title: The Troubled mind
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of a young nurse, dramatically introduced to a nursing vocation in mental hospitals, the film shows what life is like in a modern hospital dedicated to the treatment of the mentally sick.
